meanings.definition: Of the same kind or nature.
meanings.sent1: The two congenerous flowers bloomed side by side in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The congenerous animals lived peacefully in the same habitat.
meanings.sent3: It was quite congenerous of the siblings to have such similar tastes in music.
meanings.sent4: The congenerous trees in the forest stood tall like brothers in arms.
meanings.sent5: The congenerous colors of the sunset painted the sky in harmony.

meanings.definition: Having a similar origin or relationship.
meanings.sent1: Their congenerous family histories intertwined through generations.
meanings.sent2: The congenerous languages shared common roots in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: It was congenerous how their paths crossed at the same place every day.
meanings.sent4: The congenerous traditions of the two villages echoed through the hills.
meanings.sent5: Their congenerous beliefs bonded them together in a unique way.

meanings.definition: A person or thing of the same kind or nature.
meanings.sent1: She found a congenerous soul in her best friend.
meanings.sent2: The congenerous of the two cars made it hard to tell them apart.
meanings.sent3: The congenerous of the two books on the shelf seemed to call out to each other.
meanings.sent4: He was a congenerous in his love for adventure and exploration.
meanings.sent5: The congenerous of the two sculptures highlighted their shared artistic style.
